Istana Mulai Ungkap Kriteria Calon Dewan Pengawas KPK
04 Nov 2019, 20:11 by Denisa Tristianty


Istana Mulai Ungkap Kriteria Calon Dewan Pengawas KPK

Jakarta, KBRN : Rencana Pemerintah Pusat dalam membentuk Dewan Pengawas Komisi Pemberantas Korupsi (KPK) belum selesai hingga saat ini. Padahal, rencana itu sudah ditetapkan Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) sebelum menjalani pelantikan, pada Minggu (20/10/2019) lalu.
Sementara, Menteri Sekretaris Negara (Mensetneg) Pratikno baru dapat memastikan anggota Dewan Pengawas KPK akan diisi pakar hukum. Itu, salah satu kriteria calon Dewan Pengawas KPK.
“Tentu saja ahli hukum yang akan banyak, ya. Tapi, juga ada non-hukum, ada dimensi sosialnya muncul,” kata Pratikno di Jakarta, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara, Senin (4/11/2019).
Pratikno juga belum dapat memastikan calon nama yang akan dipilih langsung oleh presiden. Itu berdasarkan Pasal 69A Tentang Perubahan UU KPK. Bunyi Pasal 69A UU Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 adalah “Ketua dan anggota Dewan Pengawas untuk pertama kalinya ditunjuk dan diangkat oleh Presiden Republik Indonesia.”
“Tapi, belum diputuskan final. Sekarang masih listing-lah,” ujar dia.
Pratikno mengaku, saat ini pemerintah mendapat masukan dari banyak pihak. Pemilihan Dewan Pengawas KPK dipilih presiden dianggap masih memiliki banyak waktu.
“Nanti, (Dewan Pengawas KPK) diangkat bersamaan dengan pimpinan KPK yang baru, masih bulan Desember. Sementara ini, Pak Presiden (Jokowi) setiap saat ketemu (Pratikno) selalu meminta masukan, kira kira siapa,” ujar dia.
Pembentukan Dewan Pengawas KPK ditunjuk langsung presiden juga diatur dalam Pasal 37A, Pasal 37B, Pasal 37B, Pasal 37D, Pasal 37E, Pasal 37F, Pasal 37G, Pasal 69B, Pasal 69C, dan Pasal 69D Undang-Undang Nomor 19 Tahun 2019.
“Intinya kan, (Dewan Pengawas KPK) mengawal kerja pimpinan KPK yang baru,” tegas Pratikno.
Komisi III DPR RI telah menetapkan lima komisioner KPK periode 2019-2024, pada Jumat (13/9/2019). Saat itu, sebanyak 56 anggota Komisi III DPR mewakili seluruh fraksi partai politik telah memilih lima dari sepuluh calon pimpinan KPK yang telah menjalani fit an proper test.
Lima komisioner baru KPK itu adalah Nawawi Pomolango (hakim di Pengadilan Tinggi Denpasar, Bali) mengantongi 50 suara, Lili Pintaul Siregar (wakil ketua Lembaga Perlindungan Saksi dan Korban/LPSK periode 2013-2018) mengantongi 44 suara, Nurul Ghufron (Dekan Fakultas Hukum Universitas Jember) 51 suara.
Kemudian, ada Alexander Marwata (petahan komisioner KPK, sekaligus mantan hakim Tipikor) 53 suara, dan terakhir adalah Kapolda Sumatera Selatan, Irjen Firli Bahuri yang berhasil ditunjuk sebagai Ketua KPK periode 2019-2024 dengan 56 suara.
Di sisi lain, Undang-Undang KPK Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 telah mendapat penolakan dari mahasiwa dan banyak kalangan. Penolakan itu telah terjadi dalam aksi ‘Reformasi Dikorupsi’ di Jakarta pada, Senin (28/10/2019). Salah satu tuntutan yang disampaikan oleh kelompok mahasiswa saat itu berisi tuntutan “Terbitkan Perppu KPK”. (Foto : ANTARAFOTO)

Palace Begins to Reveal Criteria for KPK Supervisory Board Candidates
Nov 04 2019, 20:11 by Denisa Tristianty


Palace Begins to Reveal Criteria for KPK Supervisory Board Candidates

Jakarta, KBRN: The Central Government's plan to form a Supervisory Board for the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) has not been completed until now. In fact, the plan was set by President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) before undergoing the inauguration on Sunday (10/20/2019).
Meanwhile, Minister of State Secretary (Menetneg) Pratikno can only ensure that members of the KPK Supervisory Board will be filled with legal experts. That is one of the criteria for candidates for the KPK Supervisory Board.
"Of course there will be a lot of legal experts, yes. But, there is also a non-law, a social dimension emerges, "Pratikno said in Jakarta, as reported by the Antara News Agency, Monday (11/04/2019).
Pratikno also has not been able to ascertain which candidate names will be chosen directly by the president. That is based on Article 69A Regarding Changes to the KPK Law. The sound of Article 69A of Law Number 19 Year 2019 is "The Chair and members of the Supervisory Board for the first time are appointed and appointed by the President of the Republic of Indonesia."
"But, the final has not been decided yet. Now it's still listing, "he said.
Pratikno admitted, currently the government received input from many parties. The election of the KPK Supervisory Board elected by the president is considered to still have a lot of time.
"Later, (the KPK Supervisory Board) will be appointed together with the new KPK leadership, still in December. In the meantime, Mr. President (Jokowi) always meets (Pratikno) always asking for input, who do you think he is, "he said.
The formation of the KPK Supervisory Board appointed directly by the president is also regulated in Article 37A, Article 37B, Article 37B, Article 37D, Article 37E, Article 37F, Article 37G, Article 69B, Article 69C, and Article 69D of Law Number 19 of 2019.
"The point is, (the KPK Supervisory Board) oversees the work of the new KPK leadership," said Pratikno.
Commission III of the Indonesian House of Representatives has appointed five KPK commissioners for the period 2019-2024, on Friday (9/13/2019). At that time, as many as 56 members of the House of Representatives Commission III representing all political party factions had chosen five out of ten candidates for the KPK leadership who had undergone a fit and proper test.
The five new KPK commissioners are Nawawi Pomolango (judge at the Denpasar High Court, Bali) pocketed 50 votes, Lili Pintaul Siregar (deputy chair of the 2013-2018 Witness and Victim Protection Institute / LPSK) pocketed 44 votes, Nurul Ghufron (Dean of the University of Law Faculty) Jember) 51 votes.
Then, there was Alexander Marwata (commissioned by the KPK commissioner, as well as a former Corruption Judge) 53 votes, and finally the South Sumatra Regional Police Chief Inspector General Firli Bahuri who was successfully appointed as Chair of the KPK 2019-2024 with 56 votes.
On the other hand, the Corruption Eradication Commission Law Number 19 Year 2019 has been rejected by students and many groups. The rejection occurred in the 'Corruption Reformation' action in Jakarta on Monday (10/28/2019). One of the demands made by the student group at that time contained the demand for "Issue Perppu KPK". (Photo: ANTARAFOTO)
